org.hkijena.jipipe.extensions.plots.datatypes

Class PlotData

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hkijena.jipipe.extensions.plots.datatypes.PlotData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JIPipeData, JIPipeValidatable, JIPipeParameterCollection
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CategoryPlotData, HistogramPlotData, PiePlotData, XYPlotData

    public abstract class PlotData
extends Object
implements JIPipeData, JIPipeParameterCollection, JIPipeValidatable
    Contains all necessary data to generate a plot

    • Method Detail

      • display

        public void display(String displayName,
                    JIPipeWorkbench workbench,
                    JIPipeDataSource source)
        Description copied from interface: JIPipeData
        This function should display the data in the GUI. The UI can handle multiple of such operations via JIPipeDataDisplayOperation that can be registered separately. This item will always be shown as "Default" in the list of operations.
        Specified by:
        display in interface JIPipeData
        Parameters:
        displayName - a name that can be used
        workbench - the workbench
        source - optional source of the data. Can be null or any kind of data type (e.g. JIPipeDataSlot)

      • preview

                         int height)
        Description copied from interface: JIPipeData
        This function generates a preview component for usage within the GUI Can return null
        Specified by:
        preview in interface JIPipeData
        Parameters:
        width - the target width
        height - the target height
        Returns:
        the component or null if none should be available

      • saveTo

        public void saveTo(Path storageFilePath,
                   String name,
                   boolean forceName,
                   JIPipeProgressInfo progressInfo)
        Description copied from interface: JIPipeData
        Saves the data to a folder
        Specified by:
        saveTo in interface JIPipeData
        Parameters:
        storageFilePath - A folder that already exists
        name - A name reference that can be used to generate filename(s)
        forceName - If enabled, the data is saved potentially destructively. Generated files must always contain the name parameter. This is used to collect results for humans or other algorithms.
        progressInfo - the progress
